items.content_html:
Description

Add a release note about support for session.storage in Firefox 115. See Bug 1823713 Implement storage.session in extension process.
items.title: Release note for storage.session

items.content_html:
Fixes #26101

Using the web speech API was written many years ago and includes browser compatibility information that is inaccurate and not particularly useful. The current story is that most APIs are supported on Chrome and Safari behind a WebKit prefix.

This fixes up the docs to remove the section, forcing users to check the actual support. It also tidies a few mentions of APIs that were not supported when written but are supported now.

This probably could use a proper rereview and update, but this fix definitely makes it "less wrong".

Note, I'd also accept direction you'd prefer BCD tables added to the end for the more important APIs. I kind of prefer that but my understanding is that generally we prefer no section on compatibility at all in the guide.
items.title: Using the Web Speech API - remove old browser support info

items.content_html:

Note, Django itself is up to 4.2. It is about time to update this to the new version, but that requires a little time and planning. So for now, just doing minimal tidy.
items.title: Update to Django 4.0.10

Description

Additional details

items.title: Improve "How to build custom form controls" tutorial

items.content_html:
Description

This PR mainly replaces the example on the createTreeWalker() with two more illustrative ones. It also:

  • updates the spec link of NodeFilter;
  • adds details of the filter parameter.

Motivation

I followed the original example to use only NodeFilter.FILTER_ACCEPT and NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT for a toy project, but it turns out that NodeFilter.FILTER_REJECT is unexpectedly different from NodeFilter.FILTER_SKIP, the latter of which is not explained on the MDN page.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Replace `createTreeWalker()` examples

items.title: typedarray#sort doesn't use string sorting

items.content_html:
The way this combinator works with compound selectors can be confusing and it was a surprise (to me) to see how it actually worked. I think it can easily be misinterpreted with out this specific previous knowledge.

It comes up more when using SCSS transpilation since its more common to throw around the & to refer to the hierarchy.
For example, the following may look like it will match when an element with class .bar follows another element that matches .bar when both are children of .foo but it does not.

.foo {
  .bar {
    & ~ & { ... }
  }
}

Description

I added a note and example for how this combinator handles compound selectors as it seemed non-obvious and important to understand.

Motivation

I came to MDN to find this clarity on how compound selectors were handled by the combinator. I would like to save others some time.

Additional details

n/a

Related issues and pull requests

n/a
items.title: Adding  note for compound selector use cases

items.content_html:
Description

This PR introduces a new PWA How-To guide focused on PWA shortcuts.

Motivation

This is part of our PWA doc revamp project (mdn/mdn#280) where we're creating multiple guides and how-to pages for PWA. Shortcuts is a manifest member that's been available for some time already, and it makes sense to tell readers how to use it.

Additional details

N/A

Related issues and pull requests

mdn/mdn#280
items.title: PWA shortcuts how-to page

items.content_html: The HTML manifest attribute is deprecated, but it's the first result when you search for manifest on MDN. This adds content to tell the user to not use appcache and provides links for what they were probably looking for when they landing on this page.
items.title: Update deprecated page to be useful

items.content_html:
Typo in the description of the animation-name property, it read "An animation-name value is not required to be declared in the animation shorthand property. If no name exists, there is no animation to apply on any of the properties."

instead of

"An animation-name value is required to be declared in the animation shorthand property. If no name exists, there is no animation to apply on any of the properties."

Description

Removed a typo in the description of the animation-name property, I removed the word "not"

Motivation

The typo made the definition wrong and could mess up someone's understanding

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Update index.md

items.content_html:
Description

Clarify aciveTab permission effect on executeScript when context menu is opened for a subframe. Firefox used to grant ability to execute scripts to the top level frame instead of the one where menu is actually invoked.

Motivation

Make add-on developers aware of a compatibility issue with activeTab permission and content scripts.
items.title: webext permissions: activeTab and menu for a subframe

items.content_html: A new property searchScope has been added to the search replace feature. Now we can target only code blocks as well.
items.title: Update markdownlint config to match new property
